When AI becomes your personal doctor
Artificial intelligence is no longer just a game: today it can replace a doctor, a physical therapist, even an editor.
With a clavicle injury, I personally explored how AI can become a therapeutic and cognitive ally.
From emotional support to assisted writing, to personalized rehabilitation plans, AI's superagency is already a reality.
Fell off my bike, faced a 30-day layoff. ChatGPT transformed pain into creativity: cubist sketches, post-trauma emojis, and a new way to laugh at the injury.
Unable to use the keyboard, I dictated this newsletter to AI. It drafted, corrected, and made it publishable. Like Neuralink patients, the mind speaks without a body.

cards.title: 🩺 ff.124.3 Family Doctor (and in your pocket)

content: AI helps where healthcare is absent or inefficient. From Argentina to my fracture: diagnosis, advice, and progress, all in your pocket. Reid Hoffman calls it 'superagency'.
It managed physical therapy, an Ironman plan, and analyzed collagen's role in bone regrowth. Not the best doctor, but always present. And often, that's enough.

Increasingly superhuman AI systems are emerging, with their own languages and unprecedented capabilities. Two AIs decided to communicate in ggwave, deeming it more efficient than English, while EVO 2 'speaks DNA' and helps us understand genetic mutations.

cards.title: 🙏 ff.119.2 If the Priest is an AI

content: Priest Petja Kopperoinen celebrated the first 'generative mass' with AI-powered Christ avatars and gospel music generated with Suno, a possible answer to the decline in the number of priests. Harari suggests the idea of humans 'augmented by AI,' like Steven Kotler who uses AI to facilitate flow and creativity.

From China comes Manus AI, a 'ChatGPT that controls your PC.' This AI agent stands out for being an excellent multi-step planner, capable of executing complex tasks more effectively than its predecessors.

cards.title: 🍦 ff.119.4 Better Than DALL-E: Art and Ice Cream

content: Google has released Gemini 2.0 with native image generation, presenting itself as an alternative to Photoshop. In an ever-expanding landscape of AI models, this technology offers new creative possibilities, like putting 'ice cream everywhere'.
The computational efficiency of the human brain compared to supercomputers
Nature-inspired innovations: from neuromorphic computers to DNA writing
A sustainable future through biology and the decoding of natural languages

cards.title: 🧠 ff.122.1 The Computational Efficiency of the Brain

content: A human brain (20 W) is a million times more efficient than the Frontier supercomputer (21 MW). AlphaGo beat the Go champion, but consumed the energy a human would use in a decade.
Paradoxical: AI simulates brain connections at the software level, but classic (binary) hardware doesn't replicate the analog and continuous complexity of neurons.
George Church encoded the book «Regenesis» in DNA. Today, Asimov Press sells DNA-books: €60, 240 pages, 500,000 molecules.
Neri Oxman (MIT) combines design, biology, and technology to create footwear produced by living organisms, reducing waste and CO₂.
Google is developing DolphinGemma to decipher dolphin language: a step towards interspecies communication thanks to AI.
Do cows pollute as much as the United States?
Are silent gas leaks a problem for the climate?
How did Hemingway eat his hamburger?
Bovine methane emissions exceed those of the USA, equivalent to the global transport sector. Plant-based foods pollute 10x less than animal products.
Ground beef, onions, capers, and India Relish: crispy crust outside, soft center, no extra sauces.
Gas stoves leak methane even when off: the annual impact is equivalent to 500,000 cars in the United States.
La Vie's pop packaging (pink-green) shows that appealing design drives consumers towards sustainable alternatives.
Redefine Meat prints vegan burgers with realistic muscle fibers, bringing taste and texture closer to animal meat.

cards.title: 🇨🇳 ff.11.2 Is China a Special Case?

Automation and robots lower panel installation costs, accelerating the adoption of renewables.
